interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/04/11
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Adam Davidson', 'Alex Zakrzewski', 'Sarah Pia Anderson', 'Ernest Dickerson', 'Christine Moore', 'Stephen Gyllenhaal'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Pieter Jan Brugge', 'Daniel Pyne'], 'Starring': ['Titus Welliver', 'Jamie Hector', 'Amy Aquino'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Review Text: One of the best detective series available.  Bosch seems approachable but intense.  I enjoy that the Bosch in the novels and in the Amazon series are not exactly alike but very closely related.  Even if my Bosch novel character differs in my mind a bit from the Amazon Bosch, both represent an exceptional excellence in writing.  I don't watch much cable or network television but save my time for reading and Amazon series !!
Review Title: Bosch Bosch Bosch
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Alpha House
Comedy, Drama
["An Amazon Original series: They work in the Senate. They live in the house - Alpha House. Created by Garry Trudeau (Doonesbury, Tanner '88)."]
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Adam Bernstein', 'Michael Mayer', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Bob Balaban', 'Jann Turner', 'Jake Schreier', 'Antoine Douaihy', 'Clark Johnson', 'Michael Pressman'], 'Producers': ['Jonathan Alter']}
I do not like politics in real life.  But this clever show makes me laugh because I think it might be closer to the truth than politicians will admit.
Funny pokes at politics
Justified
Suspense, Western, Drama, Action
["Deputy US Marshal Raylan Givens (Timothy Olyphant) will start to pick at the thread of a cold case over 30 years in the making, unraveling a riddle that echoes all the way back to his boyhood and his criminal father's bad dealings. Meanwhile, Boyd Crowder (Walton Goggins) finds his grip on Harlan loosening due to a Pentecostal preacher with a penchant for theatrics and a knack for manipulation..."]
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Fred Golan', 'Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard']}
I enjoy westerners.  Justified is a modern day cowboy tale.  Even some of the bad guys are loveable and others are just plain fun to hate.  Every once in awhile, I find myself boo and hissing at events.
love the modern day cowboy
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Starzak', 'Christopher Sadler', 'Jay Grace', 'Lee Wilton', 'Seamus Malone', 'Jean-Philippe Vine', 'Richard Webber', 'Will Becher', 'Mike Mort', 'Dave Osmand'], 'Starring': ['John Sparkes', 'Justin Fletcher', 'Kate Harbour'], 'Studio': ['Aardman Animations']}
Love Shaun the Sheep.  He IA always thinking.  He doesn't miss a beat, I hope you will be able to meet, Shaun the Sheep.  I love Shirley and Timmy too
Dont miss a beat, come watch Shaun the Sheep

Ok, I hate it when a great pilot is shown, gets great reviews and isn't picked up.  This is a GREAT  story.  I love the blend of city and country settings, I like the characters, and I want to know what happens to brothers, cousins, and grandparents.  More, more, more please !!
I Want To Know What's Next
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Niall MacCormick'], 'Producers': ['Helen Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
I recently read many of Trollope' s novels and was thrilled to see that a theatrical adaptation was available.  Yes the movie has some slight changes, but it is a great representation of Trollope' s work.  If you have not exposed yourself to his writing, it can be confusing at first, but all is made clear by the conclusion.  The movie was the same.  I felt as if I read the book for a second time.  Excellent
Like Both Book and Movie

Ok, my friend Linda got me hooked on the Harry Bosch novels.  Now she has me hooked on the series.  Can't wait for the next book nor the next season !!
I Could Kick Linda

profile:
User Preferences Summary:

- **Genres**: The user's enthusiasm for crime dramas continues to thrive, particularly with detective series that highlight engaging writing and complex narratives. Their established fondness for comedy and drama, especially satire and political humor, remains prevalent. They are also exploring Westerns and suspense dramas, showcasing a growing appreciation for intricate storytelling. A continued interest in adaptations of literary works alongside animated content reflects their desire for diverse narrative experiences.

- **Tone**: They favor narratives that intertwine humor with serious themes like politics and morality. Their interest in nuanced character dynamics, including relatable villains and moral complexity, spans various genres, including animation and classic literature adaptations.

- **Content Sensitivity**: The user is comfortable engaging with mature themes, valuing gritty storytelling that entertains while offering depth, applicable to both animated and mature-oriented family content.

- **Viewing Purpose**: Their engagement signals a pursuit of entertainment that is reflective of real-world issues, seeking narratives that provide social commentary while evoking emotions of tension, humor, and introspection.

- **Engagement Style**: With a penchant for clever writing and intricate character arcs, the user has shown a particular investment in character-driven stories. Their recent focus on detective narratives underscores their appreciation for well-developed characters and exemplary writing quality. They prioritize immersive series over traditional cable/network television, leaning towards streaming platforms for their viewing choices.
